text: Joan Adams Mondale (née Adams; August 8, 1930 – February 3, 2014) was the second lady of the United States from 1977 to 1981 as the wife of the 42nd vice president of the United States, Walter Mondale. ==Early life and education== Mondale was born to John Maxwell Adams and Eleanor Jane Hall. She was one of the three daughters in her family. She attended schools in Wallingford, Pennsylvania. ==Death== On February 2, 2014, the Mondale family announced that she had entered hospice care for Alzheimer's disease. She died at the hospice from the disease in Minneapolis the following day, surrounded by members of her family. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:People from Eugene, Oregon Category:People from Minnesota Category:Second Ladies of the United States
